summary: This document contains preparation notes for the trial testimony of Juan Alessi, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein. It details Alessi's review of evidence (GX-52, a directory, and GX-606, a manual/handbook), his recollections of Epstein's properties and operations, and his interactions with and observations of Ghislaine Maxwell and a minor victim. It includes a declaration by Alessi regarding his employment and observations.

persons.name: Juan P. Alessi
persons.role: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, witness
persons.context: Former estate manager for Jeffrey Epstein from 1991 to 2002. He is being prepared for trial testimony, reviewing evidence and recalling details about Epstein's operations, properties, and associates.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case. Alessi was his employee from 1991 to 2002, managing his Palm Beach estate. The document references his instructions, properties, and associations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as GM. Alessi states she gave him an employee manual/handbook. He recalls her dog, Max, and that she received little mail at the Palm Beach house.

connections.description: Alessi was employed by Epstein from 1991 to 2002 as his estate manager in Palm Beach.
Alessi interacted with Maxwell during his employment, receiving an employee manual from her and observing her presence at Epstein's properties.
Maxwell is depicted as closely associated with Epstein's operations. Alessi recalls Epstein instructing him to remove Maxwell's photographs when he was bringing "someone else he was interested in."

events.title: Alessi begins employment with Epstein
events.description: Juan Alessi starts working for Jeffrey Epstein, managing his Palm Beach estate.

events.title: Renovations at Epstein's Palm Beach home
events.description: Epstein's Palm Beach house undergoes renovations, requiring him to move out for 4-6 months.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell acquires dog Max
events.description: Alessi recalls Maxwell getting her dog, Max, around this time.

events.title: Construction of wall at Palm Beach property
events.description: Epstein built a large wall between the pool and barracks at his Palm Beach home, completed just before 2002.

events.title: Alessi ends employment with Epstein
events.description: Juan Alessi's employment with Jeffrey Epstein concludes.

events.title: Trial testimony preparation
events.description: AUSA and SA prepare Juan Alessi for trial testimony, showing him evidence exhibits GX-52 and GX-606.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida 33480
keyFacts: Juan Alessi, Epstein's former estate manager, identified GX-52 as a directory similar to one he saw at Epstein's Palm Beach home, containing numerous high-profile names.
Alessi received an employee manual/handbook from Ghislaine Maxwell, which he compared to exhibit GX-606, noting several discrepancies.
Alessi's declaration states he observed a minor victim (and her mother) on three occasions at Epstein's Palm Beach home and was instructed by Epstein to pick her up on at least one occasion.
Alessi clarified that, upon reflection for trial, he believes he picked up the minor victim more times than stated in a prior affidavit and that his wife also picked her up.
The document notes Epstein would sometimes instruct Alessi to remove all of Ghislaine Maxwell's photographs because "he was bringing someone else who he was interested in."
